title: MONOGRAM Whiskey Custom 2-in Cocktail Ice Cube Tray, Personalized Silicone Cocktail Ice Cube Mold, Holiday Gift For Him, Ice Stamp
description: Make unique, speakeasy-worthy ice cubes at home with a monogram ice tray! Effortlessly elevate your next cocktail night with ice cubes bearing your initials or couple’s monogram. Our unique ice trays are made-to-order in the United States and make an excellent gift for the home bartender in your life. They're also ideal for adding a sophisticated and personalized touch to special occasions such as weddings and anniversaries. Cheers!FEATURES:- Makes 2 inch ice cubes - perfect for a standard rocks glass- Personalize each ice cube with up to three initials in a classic monogram style- Soft silicone remains flexible when frozen, making removing cubes a breeze- Made-to-order by a small business in Concord, Massachusetts- Designed to last a lifetime- Lids are available for this mold type through a separate listing here:https://www.etsy.com/listing/1083661252/silicone-ice-tray-lid-for-bemoldMATERIALS:- Food grade silicone- Free of BPA, lead, and phthalates- Dishwasher and oven safe up to 400FMEASUREMENTS:- 2 cube ice tray: 4.5” length x 2.5” width x 2.3” height- 4 cube ice tray: 4.5” length x 4.5” width x 2.3” height- 6 cube ice tray: 6.5” length x 4.5”width  x 2.3” height- Ice cubes: 2.0” length x 2.0” width x 2.0” height--HOW TO ORDER:Please type the initials from left to right in the EXACT order you want them to appear on ice. For an individual’s monogram, it is traditional to arrange the initials from left to right as first name, last name, middle name. So for Sarah Jessica Parker, you would type SPJ. For a couple’s monogram, it is traditional to arrange the initials from left to right as one person’s first name, the shared last name, and the other person’s first name. So for Victoria and David Beckham, you would order VBD. To see how your initials will appear, please reference the style guide in the product photos.Please note that the beloved round monogram style requires letters to conform to a circle. As a result, some letters may look unusual depending on their placement. For the full monogram alphabet, please reference this link: https://tinyurl.com/mdxmcm5sVisit our shop or to find our listings for ice trays that allow you to include plain text or a custom logo / graphic!--TIPS FOR PHOTOGENIC ICE:1. Use distilled water: Tap water naturally contains impurities which cause white cloudy balls to form in the cubes as they freeze. To minimize cloudiness, we recommend filling your mold with distilled water, which is free from impurities and is readily available at grocery stores for about $1 per gallon.2. Remove air bubbles: The surface of your ice cubes may have pockmarks created by air bubbles that were stuck inside your design or clinging to the walls of the ice tray when frozen. Prevent this by using a chop stick or butter knife to release any visible air bubbles from the mold before freezing.3. Temper the ice: Before putting the ice in your drink, place it on a dinner plate for a few minutes to allow it to warm up slighty. This prevents it from cracking as soon as it hits the room temperature liquor.4. Allow frost to form: As the ice warms up outside of the freezer, moisture in the air will condense on the surface of the ice, creating a nice frost that makes the appearance of your monogram much sharper. That's the secret to our photos!5. Keep it dry: here's our spin on the old adage - ice before liquor, design fades quicker. Liquor before ice, looking nice. In other words, carefully add your tempered, frosty ice cube to your drink last to keep the design dry. If you pour room temperature liquor over your frosty design, it will quickly vanish, and you'll be quite disappointed!--BULK ORDER INQUIRIES:Send us a message and we'd be happy to get back to you with pricing!POLICIES:- Our refund policy is available upon request.- Our return/exchange policy can be located at the bottom of every listing.- Have a question? The best way to contact us is to send us a direct message.*Due to the nature of our production process and order volume, all delivery dates are subject to change.
